unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Plant Manager | 1 of 2
question_text: A plant manager wants to see if there are different proportions of defective items among the four machines at her automotive plant. She randomly selects $100$ automobile parts from each of the four machines, as shown in the table below: Machine A B C D Number of Defective Parts 58 55 51 66 Is there appropriate evidence the machines are not equal concerning proportions of defective products?

choices.text: Yes, at the 1 % , 5 % 1 % , 5 % , and 10 % 10 % alpha levels.
Yes, at the 5 % 5 % and 10 % 10 % alpha levels, but not at the 1 % 1 % level.
Yes, at the 10 % 10 % alpha level, but not the 1 % 1 % or 5 % 5 % levels.
No, not at any of the common alpha levels of 1 % 1 % , 5 % 5 % , or 10 % 10 % .
No, in fact there is strong evidence the machines are all equally accurate concerning proportions of defective products.
